meanings.definition: An event causing great and often sudden damage or distress; a disaster.
meanings.sent1: The earthquake was a calamity that destroyed many homes.
meanings.sent2: The town faced a calamity when the flood swept away the bridge.
meanings.sent3: The picnic turned into a calamity when it started raining heavily.
meanings.sent4: The financial crisis was a calamity that shook the entire economy.
meanings.sent5: The shipwreck was a calamity that left the sailors stranded on the island.

meanings.definition: A state of deep distress or misery.
meanings.sent1: After losing her job, she fell into a calamity of despair.
meanings.sent2: The family was in a state of calamity after the sudden loss of their pet.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at baking a cake turned into a calamity of burnt edges.
meanings.sent4: The breakup brought a calamity of heartache and tears.
meanings.sent5: The lonely old man lived in a calamity of solitude and longing.
